article_title: Review & Outlook: Two Cheers for Shanghai Schools
article_text:
Chinese classrooms won the admiration of the world again this week as the OECD's Program for International Student Assessment exam, or PISA, ranked Shanghai's 15 year olds tops globally in math, science and reading. The city's talented teens and their teachers deserve commendation.

Yet Shanghai's education system has another side that is not so praiseworthy. The children of roughly 10 million of the city's 24 million residents are...
